item.title: Anduril 正在洽谈估值超过 280 亿美元的新融资
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，国防技术初创企业安杜里尔工业公司（Anduril Industries Inc.【原文：Defense technology startup Anduril Industries Inc. is in talks to double its valuation to more than $28 billion with a new funding round that would raise $2.5 billion, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 关键利率暂停后哥伦比亚通胀意外反弹
item.description: 哥伦比亚中央银行 1 月 31 日决定暂停降息周期，原因是担心物价压力再次出现，此后哥伦比亚的通胀率在上个月出人意料地加速上升。【原文：Colombia’s inflation unexpectedly accelerated last month after the central bank’s Jan. 31 decision to pause its rate cutting cycle on concern about renewed price pressures.】

item.title: 大豆种植者敦促特朗普恢复对农业的气候补贴
item.description: 美国大豆种植者正在敦促唐纳德-特朗普总统的政府恢复对种植者根据拜登时代的一项计划采用气候智能做法的付款。【原文：American soybean growers are urging President Donald Trump’s administration to resume payments for growers adopting climate-smart practices under a Biden era program.】

item.title: 特朗普为何想要加拿大的重要矿产资源
item.description: 当加拿大总理贾斯汀-特鲁多（Justin Trudeau）告诉一群高管唐纳德-特朗普总统吞并加拿大不是开玩笑时，他提出了一个理由：关键矿产。【原文：When Canada’s Prime Minister Justin Trudeau told a group of executives that President Donald Trump wasn’t kidding about annexing Canada, he offered one reason: critical minerals.】

item.title: 英国要求为苹果用户数据开设后门，这令隐私专家感到震惊
item.description: 英国政府试图让苹果公司（Apple Inc.【原文：The UK government’s attempt to get Apple Inc. to build a backdoor into customer data stored on its cloud system is alarming privacy advocates and US government leaders who warn that the move could expose users’ information worldwide.】

item.title: 创始人特朗普交易考验华尔街风险定势
item.description: 早在 12 月份，这就是跨资产人群的布局交易。唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）承诺让经济恢复增长，因此他们大量买入股票，抛售政府债券，并做多美元，以顺应美国经济增长的趋势。【原文：It was the layup trade for the cross-asset crowd back in December. With Donald Trump promising to rev the economy to capacity, they loaded up on stocks, sold government bonds and went long the dollar to ride a rising American tide.】

item.title: 英国要求苹果公司建立后门的命令令隐私权倡导者担忧
item.description:
"特朗普和苹果最好告诉英国它可以直接下地狱"，怀登说

。【原文：

‘Trump and Apple better tell the UK it can go straight to hell,’ Wyden says

】

item.title: 唐纳德-特朗普有关税战略吗？
item.description:
在本期特朗普经济学节目中，我们将探讨他最初几周的混乱局面、他是否有计划 以及他最有影响力的顾问可能是谁。【原文：

On this episode of Trumponomics, we explore the chaos of his first few weeks, whether he has a plan and who his most influential advisers might be. 

】

item.title: 财政部已使用超过 60% 的债务上限特别措施
item.description: 美国财政部援引截至 2 月 5 日的数据称，除现金储备外，美国财政部还有 1,330 亿美元的非常措施，可帮助继续支付政府账单。【原文：The US Treasury has $133 billion of extraordinary measures left, in addition to its cash pile, to help keep paying the government’s bills, the department said, citing data as of Feb. 5.】

item.title: 如何启用苹果 iCloud 端到端加密技术--英国隐私之争的焦点
item.description: 苹果公司为用户 iCloud 账户启用端到端加密的功能在英国受到抨击，英国政府官员希望苹果公司禁用该功能，并建立一个后门，让他们能够访问数据。【原文：Apple Inc.’s feature to enable end-to-end encryption for user iCloud accounts has come under fire in the UK, where government officials want the company to disable it and build a backdoor that lets them access data.】

item.title: Vanguard 创纪录地削减费用，使竞争对手步步紧逼
item.description:
基金巨头的平均费用在削减后仅为 0.07%

【原文：

Fund giant’s average fee is now just 0.07% after cuts

】

item.title: 据称 PAI 将探讨法国食品零售商 EEF 的各种选择
item.description: 知情人士透露，PAI Partners 正在考虑出售法国杂货零售商 Euro Ethnic Foods。【原文：PAI Partners is considering a potential sale of French grocery retailer Euro Ethnic Foods, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 美国消费者借款激增 408 亿美元，创历史之最
item.description: 12 月份，美国消费者未偿债务出人意料地创下历史最高纪录，这反映出信用卡余额和非循环信贷的大幅增长。【原文：US consumer debt outstanding unexpectedly surged by the most on record in December, reflecting massive increases in credit-card balances and non-revolving credit.】

item.title: 移民推动美国劳动力在特朗普上台前创下历史新高
item.description: 由于移民人数激增，1 月份美国劳动力的增幅创下历史之最，这表明在唐纳德-特朗普总统执政期间，就业增长的一个主要来源有可能放缓。【原文：The US workforce expanded by the most on record in January due to a jump in immigration, pointing to a major source of job growth at risk of slowing under President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 得克萨斯州州长助推证券交易所发展，与纽约展开竞争
item.description: 得克萨斯州州长格雷格-阿博特（Greg Abbott）正在进一步推动该州在金融领域发挥更大的作用，从股票交易到企业注册。【原文：Texas Governor Greg Abbott is amplifying his push for the state to play a bigger role in finance, from equity trading to business incorporations.】

item.title: 特朗普攻击官僚机构引发对 "黄金标准 "经济数据的担忧
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普总统采取措施访问甚至删除联邦机构的数据后，统计学家们敲响了经济数据需要保护的警钟。【原文：After President Donald Trump has taken steps to access and even remove data at federal agencies, statisticians are sounding the alarm that economic numbers need to be protected.】

item.title: 艾略特入股阿斯彭科技，交易商押注更高的收购要约
item.description: 并购套利交易商纷纷押注，艾略特投资管理公司（Elliott Investment Management）成为阿斯彭科技公司（Aspen Technology Inc.【原文：Merger-arbitrage traders are piling into bets that the emergence of Elliott Investment Management as an investor in Aspen Technology Inc. will result in a higher buyout bid from the company’s majority holder Emerson Electric Co.】

item.title: 大受欢迎的独立电影《巴拉特洛》制作人谈及下一步计划
item.description:
这款令人上瘾的纸牌游戏将在今年推出新补丁，其中将包含新的小丑纸牌和功能

。【原文：

The addictive card game will receive a new patch this year full of new Joker cards and features

】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会确认游戏服务 Roblox 是 "积极调查 "的一部分
item.description: 根据彭博新闻社获得的信息，数百万年轻人使用的视频游戏服务 Roblox 公司正在接受美国证券交易委员会的调查。【原文：Roblox Corp., the video-game service used by millions of young people, is part of an active investigation by the US Securities and Exchange Commission, according to information obtained by Bloomberg News.】

item.title: 如果联邦拨款减少，美国机场有望转向市政债务
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）推动削减政府开支，如果联邦基础设施建设资金缩减，美国机场可能会转向市政债券市场融资。【原文：US airports may turn to the municipal bond market for financing if federal funding for infrastructure is rolled back as part of President Donald Trump’s push to cull government spending.】

item.title: 美国银行将从道明银行购买 90 亿美元巨额抵押贷款组合
item.description: 据知情人士透露，美国银行（Bank of America Corp）已同意从多伦多道明银行（Toronto-Dominion Bank）购买价值 90 亿美元的住宅抵押贷款组合，因为这家加拿大贷款机构希望减持某些资产，以满足新的资产监管上限。【原文：Bank of America Corp. has agreed to buy a $9 billion portfolio of residential mortgage loans from Toronto-Dominion Bank, as the Canadian lender looks to shed certain holdings to meet a new regulatory cap on its assets, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 加密货币 ETF 希望者认为美国证券交易委员会的最新举措改变了节奏
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）选中接替加里-根斯勒（Gary Gensler）担任美国证券交易委员会主席的人选还未正式就职，但该监管机构已经在批准一些新的加密货币交易所交易基金的道路上迈出了渐进的步伐。【原文：Donald Trump’s pick to succeed Gary Gensler as chair of the SEC hasn’t been officially installed yet, but the regulator is already taking incremental steps on a path to approving a handful of new cryptocurrency exchange-traded funds.】

item.title: 马斯克 "收购 "要约在即，美国联邦政府员工人数创历史新高
item.description: 周五公布的新数据显示，1 月份美国政府雇员人数达到二战以来非人口普查年的最高水平，唐纳德-特朗普总统上任后希望裁减十分之一的联邦雇员。【原文：The US government head count grew to its highest level in any non-census year since World War II in January, according to new figures released Friday, as President Donald Trump took office looking to cut one in 10 federal employees.】

item.title: 风险投资加大对拉美金融科技贷款的投入
item.description: 风险投资公司计划加大对提供贷款和人工智能产品的拉美初创企业的投资力度，而美国利率的降低可能会在该地区经历一段枯竭期后，最快在今年为更多的首次公开募股打开大门。【原文：Venture capital firms plan to invest more in Latin American startups that offer loans and artificial intelligence products, while lower US interest rates could open the door to more initial public offerings as soon as this year after a dry spell in the region.】

item.title: 网络攻击多年后，Turn/River 同意收购 SolarWinds
item.description: Turn/River Capital 同意收购 SolarWinds 公司，交易价值 44 亿美元（包括债务），四年多前，这家软件供应商曾是俄罗斯网络攻击的中心。【原文：Turn/River Capital agreed to buy SolarWinds Corp. in a deal worth $4.4 billion, including debt, more than four years after the software provider was at the center of a Russian cyber-attack.】

item.title: Circle 的稳定币挽回了因加密货币崩溃而失去的市场份额
item.description: Circle Internet Financial Ltd. 的 USDC 稳定币已经赚回了它在 FTX 倒闭后加密货币价格暴跌时失去的所有市值。【原文：Circle Internet Financial Ltd.’s USDC stablecoin has gained back all of the market value it lost after the collapse in crypto prices following the failure of FTX.】

item.title: 特朗普称将于下周宣布互惠互利的关税措施
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示，他计划下周公布对等关税，这是他与美国经济伙伴贸易战的一次重大升级。【原文：President Donald Trump said he plans to unveil reciprocal tariffs next week in a major escalation of his trade war with US economic partners.】

item.title: 苹果公司被英国勒令建立后门以获取用户数据
item.description: 英国政府已下令苹果公司建立一个后门，允许其访问全球用户数据，此举可能引发这家 iPhone 制造商历史上最大的隐私权争夺战之一。【原文：The UK government has ordered Apple Inc. to build a backdoor to give it access to global user data, in a move that could spark one of the biggest privacy fights in the iPhone maker’s history.】

item.title: 关税延迟刺激农作物反弹至数月高位后有所回落
item.description: 在本周早些时候美国推迟对加拿大和墨西哥征收关税后，农产品市场出现反弹，交易商等待有关需求的更多线索，因此周五谷物和油籽期货价格有所回落。【原文：Grain and oilseed futures eased Friday as traders waited for more clues on demand after agriculture markets rallied earlier in the week when the US delayed tariffs on Canada and Mexico.】

item.title: 美联储库格勒关注通胀进展和政策不确定性
item.description: 美联储理事阿德里安娜-库格勒（Adriana Kugler）表示，通胀已大幅下降，但她警告说，近期进展缓慢，仍存在很大的不确定性。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Adriana Kugler said inflation has fallen significantly, but warned recent progress has been slow and that considerable uncertainty remains.】
